feed.title: Fraudsters
feed.subtitle: Fraudsters is an all-you-can-eat buffet of liars, cheaters, and scammers. Hosts Seena Ghaznavi and Justin Williams cover every flavor of fraud you can imagine from fake psychic hotlines to corporations cookin‚Äô the books.

entry.title: Episode 27: King Parker and Queen Chadwick of Fraudistan
entry.content: This week Seena and Justin take a trip back-in-time to the late 1800s to find the origin of the phrase "if you believe that, then I have a bridge to sell you" and who was the person the media called, the Queen of Swindlers. Big thanks to author Tori Telfer and her book "Confident Women: Swindlers, Grifters, and Shapeshifters of the Feminine Persuasion".

entry.title: Episode 26: Steven Hoffenberg, the Unsung Villain of Fraudsters
entry.content: You've heard of Jeffrey Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, Rudy Giuliani, Paul Manafort, Roger Stone, Rupert Murdoch, and Trump but have you heard of Steven Hoffenberg? This man was involved in so much insidious shit his defense of himself was insisting that he was just running a ponzi scheme! All that and more on today's episode.

entry.title: Episode 25: ‚ù§Ô∏èValentines Day Special‚ù§Ô∏è ‚Äì Catfish
entry.content: Happy Valentines Day! Today we're talking RoMaNcE fRaUd üòç

entry.title: Episode 24: Race Hustlers Part V ‚Äì Two Cooke‚Äôs Cook Up a Fraudulent Bank for Freedmen
entry.content: This is our last installment of our Race Hustlers series. If you haven't heard of the Freedman's Bank, you need to listen to this episode. / Special thanks to Mehrsa Baradaran for writing The Color of Money.

entry.title: Episode 23: Race Hustlers Part IV ‚Äì White Ladies
entry.content: We all remember the day Rachel Dolezal broke the internet in 2015, but at this point is it even surprising when we hear about a white lady pretending to be Black or Puerto Rican or Spanish? What drives a person to lie about something as fundamental as their racial or cultural identity? Today we're dissecting the appropriations and the non-apologies from Dolezal to Hilary "I vacationed once in Spain so I am Spanish" Baldwin - all for your listening pleasure. / Huge thanks to all the wonderful guests who joined us for this episode!! / Elena Romero - fashion, hip hop, and Latinx journalist. / Elisa Prosperetti - visiting professor of history at Mount Holyoke College. / Lauren Michele Jackson - author of White Negroes. Follow Lauren on Twitter @proseb4bros for more thoughts on culture and cultural appropriation.

entry.title: Episode 22: Race Hustlers Part III - Holy Hotepery! (still dr. umar)
entry.content: Last week we looked at the claims and credentials of Dr. Umar Johnson‚Äìthe Prince of Pan-Afrikanism, Frederick Douglass' great grand cousin, and blood relative of Ramses the II (according to a spiritual medium), etcetera, etcetera. Today we reflect on his influence and impact. / Thanks to Mojak Lehoko for his thoughts for this episode. / Huge thanks to Ebony Chappel‚Äì@ebonythewriter on social‚Äìfor such a wonderful, thoughtful interview. Thanks to Lisa Kelly-Vance for helping us understand school psychology. Shout out to all the school psychologists for being awesome! / Lastly, special thanks to YT's Make A Change, Lenon Honor, King Kong Consciousness, Ms. Lauren, Anti Afro Svengalis, the "Dr. Umar is a Fraud" facebook group, and all the other folks on YT and social media who have been diligently documenting Dr. Umar's nonsensory for years and years. You made this mini-series possible!

entry.title: Episode 21: Race Hustlers Part II ‚Äì Dr. Umar, the PayPal Prince of Pan-Afrikanism
entry.content: Part II of Race Hustlers features a new huckster: Dr. Umar Johnson ‚Äì the self proclaimed Prince of Pan-Afrikanism and / "most influential Black scholar in the world." While not yet convicted by a court of law, citizen journalists and Black media outlets have been speculating on and interrogating this man for years about his beliefs, his credentials, and the school that Dr. Umar has been fundraising for for nearly a decade. Will the Frederick Douglass Marcus Garvey RBG Leadership Academy for Black Boys ever materialize or is it just another con-artist's ruse to pocket good faith donations? / Special thanks to Lisa Kelly-Vance for consulting on this episode. / Thanks to all those who shared their Dr. Umar stories online and made this episode possible.

entry.title: Episode 20: Race Hustlers Part I ‚Äî David Duke, Grand Wizard of Racism INC.
entry.content: You know David Duke the racist, but do you know David Duke the con artist? What's that? You don't want to know David Duke at all? This is Part I of our newest mini-series, Race Hustlers, on con artists who leverage race as a part of their scams. / Special thanks to Marilyn Mayo of the Anti Defamation League for sharing her wisdom with us for this episode.

entry.title: Episode 19: Barry Minkow Part III ‚Äì All the Movie Magic in Hollywood Couldn't Save this Flick
entry.content: Ever wondered what a real movie set is like? How about a movie set with mobsters, Star Wars, and a con-man at the helm? Tune in for the third installment of our mini-series on Barry Minkow and a behind the scenes look at possibly the worst movie ever made. Special thanks to Jonathan Meyer‚Äìscript doctor and screenwriter‚Äìfor his insider insights and hilarious anecdotes. Check out his awesome new radio serial on a serial killer: Midnight Tales From The Bluff City right after you listen to Fraudsters!

entry.title: Episode 18: Barry Minkow Part II ‚Äì The Triple Double of Frauds
Episode 17: Barry Minkow Part I ‚Äì ZZZZ Best Carpet Cleaning and ZZZZ Worst Fraudster
entry.content: Episode 17 kicks off our mini-series on possibly our worst fraudster yet - Barry Minkow. Part I is devoted to his youth and only his youth. Barry as a teen committed more fraud than most could in a lifetime‚Äìfrom securities fraud to check kiting to credit card fraud to carpet cleaning cons‚Äìall while in the company of nazis and mobsters.

entry.title: Episode 16: Kevin Trudeau Part III ‚Äî the Global Information Network of Illuminati and 14 CDs
entry.content: On the final episode of our series on Kevin Trudeau, we delve into one of his most recent and most outrageous scams ‚Äì a multilevel marketing company called the Global Information Network that promised secrets of the illuminati, ferraris, and inner peace. All for the low low price of many thousands of dollars, recruiting your friends and family, and giving up things you love to become "coachable." / Special thanks to Linnea, former GIN member, for a sharing her experience. / Special thanks to Edward Balleisen, fraud expert and author of Fraud: An American History from Barnum to Madoff, for his insights. Special thanks to Cosmic Connie of Whirled Musings for sharing her wealth of knowledge on GIN with us.

entry.title: Episode 15: Kevin Trudeau Part 2 ‚Äì A Colonic a Day Keeps the Doctor
entry.content: In Part II of our series on the notorious infomercial scammer Kevin Trudeau we cover how to lose 300 pounds in 30 minutes, go to prison sleep-away camp, and get a presidential pardon! / Special thanks to Howard Beales, Former Director of the Bureau of Consumer Protection at the FTC, for a wonderful conversation.

entry.title: Episode 14: Kevin Trudeau Part I ‚Äî How to Get Banned from Infomercials
entry.content: In Part I of our series on the notorious infomercial scammer Kevin Trudeau we cover how to give yourself mega-memory, break any addiction 100% of the time, and all the other things THEY don't want you to know about!

entry.title: Episode 13: Fraud Reich Part II ‚Äì The Good Ole ‚ÄúSpear of Destiny‚Äù
entry.content: In part I of Fraud Reich we brought you historical fiction‚Äîthe story of the Hitler Diaries. Today we bring you a sci-fi thriller featuring Adolph Hitler, Hans Loads, David Bowie, and a fraudster named Trevor Ravenscroft. We‚Äôre talking the ‚ÄúSpear of Destiny‚Äù‚Äî the alleged source of Hitler‚Äôs power and rot. Special thanks to Marcus Parks, founding father of the Last Podcast Network, for a magical interview.

entry.title: Episode 12: Fraud Reich Part I ‚Äì Hitler Fan Fiction (that everyone believed)
entry.content: Dear Diary, Many historically significant figures generate lore. Some say Shakespeare didn't write his plays. Some say Nikola Tesla designed blueprints for a "death ray" before his passing. Some say Thomas Jefferson drank breast milk! Few theories, however, are as wild and as widely entertained as the Hitler Diaries were. On the 12th episode of Fraudsters Season 1, we talk where the myth began and how it snowballed into 62 forged Hitler diaries lauded as true by some of the foremost historians and news outlets in Europe. So excited to share this episode with all the Spotifites out there. Love, Seena, Justin, Hazel, and Marie PS: I made up the breast milk myth

entry.title: Episode 11: Al Flores Breaks the Internet‚Ä¶ in 1999
entry.content: Remember when we actually said "world wide web?" Remember netscape? Remember the dot-com bubble? Remember Y2K? Remember when a car dealership company said it had the cure for AIDS and sold stocks for $9 through early internet message boards until someone from the FTC commented "hey, this isn't real?" No? On this weeks episode of Fraudsters we bring you Alfred Flores and Uniprime ‚Äì a con on a .com two decades ago. / Special thanks to John Reed Stark, cyber-cop extraordinaire, for a wonderful and nostalgic interview. / Special thanks to Joshua Sutherland for composing music for this episode.

entry.title: Episode 10: Anna Sorokin Part II ‚Äì Millenial Icarus
entry.content: The second installment of our two part mini-series on Anna Sorokin. We get into Anna's apprehension, the circus of the trial, and Anna's own reflections from Rikers. / Special thanks to Emily Palmer for being such a wonderful guide throughout this series. You can find Emily on all social at @emilyepalmer. Special thanks to Todd Spodek a delightful interview. Special thanks to Joshua Sutherland for music for this episode.

entry.title: Episode 9: Anna Sorokin Part I ‚Äì Gossip Girl as Directed by Aaron Sorkin (no relation)
entry.content: The first installment of our two part mini-series on Anna Delvey // Anna Sorokin.

entry.title: Episode 8: PTL and Jim Bakker Part III ‚Äì Joining Gangs and Curing Coronavirus
entry.content: Our final episode of the mini-series we walk you through justice finally being served in the case of Jim Bakker: How he went to prison for 25 years and came out as a reformed man who lived a quiet, secular life back in Michigan. / Just kidding! He barely went to prison and wasn't humbled by it at all. / On this final episode we spend more time talking about an incarcerated Jim Bakker than he spent in prison. We get into his prison hustles, his strange choice of friends, his post-release shenanigans and reflect on the series as a whole.

entry.title: Episode 7: PTL and Jim Bakker Part II ‚Äì Finding Jesus, Pissing off Korea, and Falling from Grace
entry.content: Part 2 of our mini-series on Praise the Lord and Jim Bakker. / Special thanks to Joshua Sutherland for always making amazing music for us.

entry.title: Episode 6: PTL and Jim Bakker Part I - WAP for Christians
Episode 5: Jacob Wohl Part II ‚Äì Wohlin', Trollin,' and Taking Advantage
entry.content: In part 2 of our mini-series on Jacob Wohl, we pivot to his political frauds‚Äìcovering his ploys to defame Dr. Fauci, Elizabeth Warren, and even Mayor Pete. While just as ludicrous as his earlier financial crimes, his political schemes seem to lack conviction‚Äìboth in the sense that he no longer seems invested in sustaining charades longer than it takes to create chaos and / because he isn't held responsible for them. / Special thanks to Nancy Rommelmann for a delightful interview.

entry.title: Episode 4: Jacob Wohl ‚Äì The Wohl Story (it‚Äôs mostly fiction!)
entry.content: What did you do as a teenager‚Äìjump rope? AIM your crush? Listen to Green Day on your cool new iPod classic? Going out on a limb, but we bet you weren't engaging in elaborate schemes to defraud people of their life savings! Just a guess. Our latest mini-series features Jacob Wohl‚Äìa Gen Z scammer who's gone through fraudulent business ventures faster than a normal teen goes through acne cream. On this episode we look at his financial frauds from deceptive hedgefunds to real‚ÄìFAKE‚Äìestate companies, break down the bizarre business practices with an actual finance expert, and sing. Yes... we sing. All that and more on this episode of FRAUDDDSSSTTTERSS. / Special thanks to: Simon TaufiQue for composing the amazing new theme music for Fraudsters. Joshua Sutherland for composing awesome music for this episode. Kai Elwood-Dieu for developing a killer website for this episode.

entry.title: Episode 3: The Psychic Readers Network Part III - Three White Guys and a Pizza Place
entry.content: In our final chapter on The Psychic Readers Network we celebrate never having to spell that word again. Just kidding! In our final episode of the mini-series, Justin and Seena unspin the web of lies and liars at the top of the notorious P.R.N. to unearth one lone pizza box. / Tune in for more. / Special thanks to Joshua Sutherland for composing music for this episode.

entry.title: Episode 2: The Psychic Readers Network Part II - Great Fraud, Bad Psychics, Rich Dudes
entry.content: In part II of our mini-series on the The Psychic Readers Network, Seena and Justin commune with a retired phone psychic and a former director of the Bureau of Consumer Protection to fill in the blanks on Miss Cleo and the PRN.

entry.title: Episode 1: The Psychic Readers Network Part I ‚Äì CLEO 2020
entry.content: It‚Äôs crime! It‚Äôs funny! It‚Äôs true-cromedy! In this pilot episode of Fraudsters, hosts Seena Ghaznavi and Justin Williams will take you back in time to revisit Miss Cleo and the Psychic Readers Network to find out how they swindled people out of millions, one fake reading at a time.
